page.title: 02JAYNE TORVILL-WEST NOTTINGHA
page.content: Tina interviewed Mrs Torvill,who lives opposite our school, about her daughter Jayne,World,Olympic and European Ice-dance champion,1984. Jayne was nine when she started ice skating.She had to get up at 5am to train for four to seven hours each day.Her mum felt like telling her to give up at times.The first trophy she won was the Rose Bud at Bristol with partner Christopher Dean.Jayne enjoys being professional and touring around the world.She would like better facilities in Britain to encourage young skaters to try their skills out as youngsters.Mrs Torvill did not realize Jayne was going to be a champion until she won the World Championship for the first time with Chris in 1981.She told us that you don't really expect your own daughter to become famous.
